text: hello my name is imanu wadwa and I am a
technical account manager at AWS today
I'm going to provide you with a brief
introduction to the two features in AWS
security Hub Consolidated controls View
and Consolidated control findings you
can use these features to decouple
controls from security standards and to
Consolidated control findings which can
help you significantly reduce finding
noise and administrative
overhead the Consolidated controls view
introduced a new controls page which
centralizes your security controls in
one place to help you rapidly discover
misconfigurations with minimal Contex
switching and understand the status of
controls across your
system this feature also added a unique
security control IDs across different
security standards so it's simpler for
you to reference the controls and view
their findings for example the control
AWS config should be enabled is common
across multiple standards as you can see
on the right hand side of your screen
previously it was referred to as config1
in adws Foundation security best
practice standard CIS 2.5 in CIS version
1.2.0 CIS 3.5 in the CIS version 1.4.0
and pcic config1 in the PCI DSS standard
with the assignment of unique security
control ID this control is referenced as
config do1 across standards
lastly by providing a single pane of
glass for controls you can enable or
disable a specific control across
standards in a single action which
reduces your Administration overhead of
maintaining the same status across
different
standards let us now look at security
hub's Consolidated control findings when
you turn on Consolidated control
findings security Hub will produce a
single finding per Security check even
when the underlying control is shared
across multiple standards having a
single finding per check across
standards will help you investigate
update and remediate fail findings more
quickly while also reducing finding
noise as an example we can look at
cloudtrail do2 which is shared between
all the five security standards
supported by security Hub before you
turn on this capability you might
potentially receive up to five findings
for each Security check generated by
this control with one finding for each
security standard after you turn on
Consolidated control findings these
older findings will be archived and
security Hub will generate one finding
per Security check in this control
regardless of how many security
standards you have
enabled this feature is automatically
turned on for new security Hub
activations but may need to be
retroactively turned on for previous
implementations a key point to note is
that if you're using security Hub
integration with AWS organizations or
have invited member accounts through a
manual invitation process Consolidated
control findings can only be turned on
by the administrator
account let us now take a look at demo
for Consolidated controls
view after logging into your AWS
Management console search for security
Hub service on the search
bar and click on security hub
now you're on the summary page of AWS
security
Hub click on controls in the left
navigation pane which will take you to
the new Consolidated controls
view on the controls page you can view
your overall security score across all
of your enabled standards showing as
47% the security score is updated every
24 hours and is based on the proportion
of fast controls compared to the total
number of enabled controls with
data a breakdown of Security checks
across controls with the percentage of
failed Security checks is also provided
here you can see 16% of 438 of
2,229 checks paid because many controls
can contain multiple Security checks and
multiple findings this value is
different from the security score which
considers controls as a single
object you can use this metric as well
as your security score to monitor your
progress as you work to remediate
findings next is a list of controls that
are categorized into different tabs
based on enablement and compliance
status the fail tab is displayed by
default and will provide you a view of
all the controls with a fail status
unknown tab represents control with
unknown
status the controls that that pass the
underlying checks will appear in the
past tab the disabled tab shows controls
that are disabled in all
standards and no data tab indicates that
there are no findings for the control
the number of controls in the all column
is equal to the sum of controls in the
failed unknown pass disabled and no data
columns by default all the tabs are
sorted in descending order by severity
from critical to
low
in addition security Hub allows you to
filter the control findings based on
properties such as ID title severity
compliance status and custom parameters
for example you can select the attribute
severity and set its value as critical
to ensure you only focus on the highest
priority controls that require further
attention choosing the option next to
control Security Group should not allow
unrestricted access to Ports with high
risk brings up a side panel which
displays the standards in which the
control is currently enabled and the
standards in which the current control
is currently disabled as you can see it
is enabled in one standard AWS
foundational security best practices V
1.0.0 and is not disabled in any of the
standards from this panel you can
disable a specific control by disabling
it in all standards in this case if you
want to disable the already selected
control security groups should not allow
unrestricted access to Ports with high
risk click on the button disable control
which will pop up a new window to enter
the reason for disabling the
control once you choose the appropriate
reason click disable which will disable
this
control you can also click on a specific
control to view further information here
we will click on a security groups
should not allow unrestricted access to
Ports with high risk and you can find
out which resources are scanned by this
control and what is their
status thank you for your time and for
more information please find the AWS
security Hub documentation on
Consolidated controls View and
Consolidated control findings under the
description SE
